#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Have a Family Meeting
#Text=Every family has its time when they have to talk about things and get everyone to agree on something .
#Text=Whether it 's something about when to watch TV , or discussions about a new house , we all have a good reason .
#Text=But how do you put it together ?
#Text=Follow these steps to make the family meetings a little easier for every person in your household .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide on what you want to discuss .
#Text=It is important to go into a family meeting with something important to discuss , or it will be pointless to even have it .
#Text=Do you need to talk about who owns the remote ?
#Text=Or what about the many concerts coming up ?
#Text=Or maybe it is a topic that is a little bit harder to discuss .
#Text=Make sure you know what to talk about and some replacement topics just in case things get a little too rough .
#Text=Set up the meeting .
#Text=When do want to have the meeting ?
#Text=Talk it over with your significant other and decide if your time is reasonable .
#Text=Then , talk it over with each of your kids individuality .
#Text=Tell them the time and , if appropriate , the subject .
#Text=Make sure that they are available .
#Text=If they say they do n't want to come , which will most likely occur with teenagers or tweens , tell them that they have to come because the meeting is very important .
#Text=Make sure that everyone did n't forget about the meeting the day before it is due to happen .
#Text=Especially if you planned it out well in advance , there is a chance that they might have .
#Text=Remind everyone if possible .
#Text=If they are n't available at the moment leave them a reminder on their desk or something .
#Text=Leave a note on the refrigerator .
#Text=Go to the meeting .
#Text=Make sure everyone 's there .
#Text=If they are not , go get them .
#Text=If they still ca n't make it , cancel the meeting and reschedule .
#Text=If they make it , discuss the topics and make sure everyone gets a chance to say something .
#Text=If there are a ton of bad responses from everyone in your household , then attempt to change the subject .
#Text=If things go smoothly , then you 'll know that you did a great job .
#Text=Apply the discussion in real life .
#Text=For example , if you discussed a TV schedule , abide by that schedule .
#Text=If your whole household has to do something and you do n't , they will most likely think that it is unfair , and they will become very upset with you .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Sometimes some meetings may have information that some kids are not ready to hear .
#Text=If they seemed confused during then meeting , then sit down with them after the meeting is over and explain what you talked about in terms that they can understand better .

#Text=If any of your younger kids throw a fit about any topic because they do n't like it , then excuse them and yourself , and go to talk to them for a minute so that they can work to accept the change .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Make sure not to yell at anyone if they are upset or confused .
#Text=It will only make things worse for everyone in the household , because yelling may start an argument .
